holidays.name: World Vegan Day
holidays.description: A day celebrating the benefits of veganism for health, animals, and the environment. It encourages people to embrace a cruelty-free lifestyle.
holidays.origin: Established in 1994 by the vegan society to mark 50 years since coining the term 'vegan'.
holidays.funFact: World Vegan Day not only promotes plant-based diets but also initiates vegan festivals, potlucks, and clothing swaps worldwide.

holidays.name: Day of the Dead (Dia de los Muertos)
holidays.description: A vibrant Mexican holiday honoring deceased loved ones with altars, marigolds, and sugar skulls to celebrate their lives joyfully.
holidays.origin: An ancient indigenous tradition blended with Catholicism, observed since pre-Columbian times.
holidays.funFact: Sugar skulls are personalized with the names of departed souls and placed on altars as a joyful remembrance rather than mournful symbol.

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: A solemn Christian feast honoring all saints, known and unknown, who have attained heaven, reflecting on the continuity of the faithful.
holidays.origin: Celebrated since the 4th century, officially established by Pope Gregory III in the 8th century.
holidays.funFact: In some countries, people visit cemeteries to clean graves and decorate them with flowers and candles, creating a glowing tribute.

holidays.name: National Cook Something Bold and Pungent Day (USA)
holidays.description: A quirky food holiday inviting home cooks to embrace bold and pungent flavors in their culinary experiments today!
holidays.origin: Unofficial day created to encourage culinary creativity and daring flavor combinations.
